problem: A large rectangle has side lengths of $(x+7)$ and $(x+5)$. In the large rectangle, there is a rectangular hole with side lengths of $(2x-3)$ and $(x-2)$. What is the area of the large rectangle (not including the area of the hole)? Express your answer as a polynomial in $x$.
model_solution:
Step 1: Calculate the area of the large rectangle by multiplying its side lengths: $(x+7)(x+5)$.
$(x+7)(x+5)=x^{2}+5x+7x+35=x^{2}+12x+35$
Step 2: Calculate the area of the hole by multiplying its side lengths: $(2x-3)(x-2)$.
$(2x-3)(x-2)=2x^{2}-4x-3x+6=2x^{2}-7x+6$
Step 3: Subtract the area of the hole from the area of the large rectangle: $(x^{2}+12x+35)-(2x^{2}-7x+6)$.
$(x^{2}+12x+35)-(2x^{2}-7x+6)=-x^{2}+19x+29$
Final Answer: $-x^{2}+19x+29$

Step 2: Calculate the area of the hole by multiplying its side lengths: $(2x-3)(x-2)$.
$(2x-3)(x-2)=2x^{2}-4x-3x+6=2x^{2}-7x+6$

Step 3: Subtract the area of the hole from the area of the large rectangle: $(x^{2}+12x+35)-(2x^{2}-7x+6)$.
